title: Seafood Okonomiyaki
description: A traditional Japanese savory pancake dish with seafood!
directions: Defrost froze seafood in a salt water (2 cup water, 2 tbsp salt) in a bowl.
In a large bowl, mix and whisk the flour, water and dashi well. Add the eggs and mix well
Chop the cabbage into small pieces and add to the bowl.
Drain the salt water and add the seafood to the large bowl and mix well.
Pour 1 meal portion into a heated pan (about 3 scoops with a small scoop) and cook for 3 min on medium heat
Flip the pancake, cover with a lid and cook for 3 min.
Serve on plate and pour okonomi sauce, Japanese mayo, seaweed flakes or any sauce of your choie

title: Karaage: Japanese Fried Chicken
ingredients: Men Tsuyu (Noodle Soup Base Concentrated): 1 tbsp
directions: Prepare a big zipclock bag. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and place them into the bag
Add the Dashi, Men Tsuyu, and Japanese Mayo to the bag and squeeze/mix the bag for 1 min. Leave in room temperature for 30 min
Add the potato starch to the bag and squeeze the bag well.
Prepare a medium size pot. Pour enough oil to cover the bottom and some more. Heat up the oil to 180C/355F (medium high heat for 5~7 min)
Place 5~8 chicken pieces into the pot. Cook on one side for 2 min. Try to keep the temperature close to 170C/340F
Flip the chicken pieces and cook for another 2 min. Occassionally flip the chickens at the end of the timer
Remove the chicken pieces and place them in a plate with paper towels on it and let it cool for at least 1 min
Serve with rice, broccoli, miso soup or any side dish of your choice. Feel free to add salt, pepper, lemon or Japanese mayo to the chicken

title: Salmon Poke
description: A simple and quick Poke recipe!
directions: Start cooking the rice.
Prepare a large bowl. Dice the sashimi, tamago, onions, and avocado into cubes and add them to the bowl.
Add minced garlic, soy sauce, oyster, sauce, ajinomoto, wasabi, sesame seeds to the bowl and mix well.
Serve over rice and enjoy!

title: Lu Rou Fan
description: Delicious Taiwanese Braised Pork Rice Bowl!
ingredients: Chinese seasoning paste/Chicken chicken bouillon: 1/2 tsp
directions: Cook eggs in boiling water for 10 min. Soak in water and remove the shells.
Slice the onions, cut each bok choy leaves into 4 pieces, mince the garlic, and dice the pork into small cubes
Start cooking the rice.
Cook the onions in a pan with oil and salt until brown. Add the pork and cook on high heat until the surfaces are brown.
Add the garlic and cook on medium heat for 1 min
Add water, soy suace, sake, paste, oyster sauce, five-spice, boiled eggs to the pan and cook on low-mid heat for 30~40 min.
While the pork is cooking, cook the boy choy in boiling water for 30 seconds.
Slice the eggs in half, serve the pork, eggs, bok choy over rice. Pour the sauce from the pan on top.
